channel.title: Free webhost?
channel.description:
Hey, I'm trying to find a webhost that will allow cgi scripts to make socket connections. I've tried sooo many but none seem to work.
I've been with onlytwodollars.com for over a year, they allowed pretty much everything and I had a gb of filespace, 8 gb bandwidth, all script support etc.. Recently they do not allow cgi scripts to make socket connections, so my site is now pointless(It was a password protected proxy that I used at school).
Any help? Thanks

item.title: Free webhost?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Ah, that makes sense. But again, I’ve never seen any host explicitly state that they allow/disallow socket connections from cgi scripts, so sorry I can’t be of more help there.

Read full topic

item.title: Free webhost?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“BobDole81, post:7, topic:23341”][quote author=jme_009 link=topic=35510.msg427449#msg427449 date=1163099886]

Take a look through this free webhost directory to see what suits your needs: http://www.free-webhosts.com/

I was there before, but it only says if cgi scripts are allowed, but it does not say if they can make socket connections. I tried a million different hosts from there and I just couldn’t get any to work.
[/quote]
Do cgi hosts typically have such limitations? I’ve never seen such specifications either when reading webhost specs. I’ve never had a problem with this with php hosts, so I can’t imagine why cgi would be much different.[/quote]
Most hosts would not want you making a proxy with their free hosting since it slows down the server a lot. It’s nearly impossible to use cgiproxy with a free host, it’ll just have an error.

Read full topic

item.title: Free webhost?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:5, topic:23341”][quote author=BobDole81 link=topic=35510.msg427405#msg427405 date=1163097732]
Take a look through this free webhost directory to see what suits your needs: http://www.free-webhosts.com/
[/quote]
I was there before, but it only says if cgi scripts are allowed, but it does not say if they can make socket connections. I tried a million different hosts from there and I just couldn’t get any to work.[/quote]
Do cgi hosts typically have such limitations? I’ve never seen such specifications either when reading webhost specs. I’ve never had a problem with this with php hosts, so I can’t imagine why cgi would be much different.

Read full topic
